title: Queentoshi
author: Queentoshi
content: Sorry I may be asking so many questions at once, but I am having a rush of related thoughts amd just had to share it for us to learn. How much do you love bitcoins? But think about it, what kind of situation do you think can push you into stopping to hold bitcoins and invest more in it? please share your episode. Has your love for Bitcoin surpassed your love for country? If your government threatens arrest for anyone found to still be involved in bitcoins, are you willing to go to jail even if it is just for a day?Will you be willing to relocate from your country to another region if the environment becomes unsafe for people like you who have invested in bitcoins? If you had money that you had already planned to DCA into bitcoins and a close family member or friend with a pressing financial need comes up to you to ask you for some financial help, will you be willing to skip your DCA plans and help them? How should we react in such a situation.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Not surprising, another one user who treat Bitcoin as their God and willing to die for Bitcoin.If the government threatens to arrest people who hold Bitcoin, then I don't give a fuck because I use no KYC P2P and never send my personal document, so I'm safe!As for family member that need financial support, just use your brain to answer that, if you're stingy and not happy to help anyone including your closest family, then you can choose to not give your money.

comments.author: btc78
comments.body: Quote from: Queentoshi on June 13, 2024, 12:52:52 PMHow much do you love bitcoins? But think about it, what kind of situation do you think can push you into stopping to hold bitcoins and invest more in it? please share your episode. Love is a big word.  Don’t love money too much even if it brings you so much joy. Bitcoin has changed a lot of lives and has helped a lot of people but at the end of the day it is still money and we shouldn’t love it too much.QuoteHas your love for Bitcoin surpassed your love for country? If your government threatens arrest for anyone found to still be involved in bitcoins, are you willing to go to jail even if it is just for a day? What is the point of using bitcoin if I won’t get too use it for the rest of my life as I am in jail? Bitcoin is great but I suggest we all follow the law.QuoteWill you be willing to relocate from your country to another region if the environment becomes unsafe for people like you who have invested in bitcoins?  If I had the money to relocate, I would but I don’t and that’s why I am investing in bitcoin. Don’t lose yourself too much in bitcoin and crypto. Don’t let it consume and control your whole being. It is our future but not our everything.

You can't simply be investing into bitcoin at the expense of your security. if my country actually bans bitcoin i think it will be appropriate for me to abide by the rules, moreover bitcoin can be use anonymously, so why publicizing it to get the government at my back, even Satoshi wouldn't want me to go to jail just to use bitcoin. i will anonymously use bitcoin and wait till the government relaxes its laws. Yes in a country that i think has strict laws i would love to move away to a more friendly country not because of bitcoin only but considering other things too. comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: I love bitcoin enough that I don't get easily swayed by FUD and in fact, I just really love that whenever FUD happens, I almost always know that bitcoin will go down in prices and it's going to be a great opportunity to buy more bitcoins for yourself, ain't no way that bitcoin will be going down in an indefinite time, the brief or temporary price drops are a buying opportunity for many of us. I don't obsess too much about bitcoin though, it feels really stupid to me that you would go so much at that point in something that could easily destroy your life if you do it wrong, don't be too obsessed like me, that's the logical thing to do and much healthier thing to do when you're invested in bitcoin.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: The only thing that will stop me from holding bitcoin is death or bitcoin crashes, which the chance of that happening is very slim.I don't love bitcoin to the extent of relocating to another country in order for me to spend my bitcoin. There are decentralized exchanges which will make the use of bitcoin possible, the law will affect those using centralized platforms.I will get out the funds that I wanted to use to DCA for that week, if my close family member is in an urgent need. I will skip that week and whenever I am more funds, I will double my DCA for that week.

comments.author: Assface16678
comments.body: I think if I were to rate how much I love bitcoin, it would be 8 out of 10. Why not 10? Well, it's because we know that bitcoin still has its disadvantages, but it is 8—meaning it has many advantages, and bitcoin has given me a lot of opportunity. It has made me independent when it comes to money since I was in college, and because of bitcoin, I have learned to become more money-oriented and business-minded. So in short, I love bitcoin because it changes my life and it keeps on giving more opportunity and, of course, money at this time. That's why, no matter what others say about bitcoin, I will never let go of it. I will keep on believing in bitcoin, and I will keep on supporting bitcoin until the end. And I think we all love bitcoin, because why are we here in this forum if not right?

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: If there is anyone who love Bitcoin, I'm one of them because Bitcoin have actually helped me in solving real problem. I got into Bitcoin from the angle of usage and not just investment like many people here. Bitcoin helped me when our government placed embargo on FX, which made it hard for us to do international transactions. I came to find out about the investment aspect of Bitcoin later because I just thought Bitcoin was all about usage as a medium of exchange. It will really be difficult to measure how much I love Bitcoin because many things about me revolve around Bitcoin.

comments.author: Alpha Marine
comments.body: Quote from: Queentoshi on June 13, 2024, 12:52:52 PMIf you had money that you had already planned to DCA into bitcoins and a close family member or friend with a pressing financial need comes up to you to ask you for some financial help, will you be willing to skip your DCA plans and help them? How should we react in such a situation?This is like asking if you'd help out a friend or close relative if he needed financial help and you were in a position to help. I understand what bitcoin is, but let's not make it more than it is. It's not more important than the lives of our loved ones. If the financial need is very serious and the person is close to you, why not make the sacrifice? I mean, it's not like you're not going to make any money again to DCA if you sacrifice this one. We shouldn't look down on relationships. Bitcoin is money, most likely the best form of money, but it's still money nonetheless, so it shouldn't be treated more than it is.We shouldn't let money take centre stage in our lives. The people who love us and matter to us should take priority in my opinion.
